text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro. welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies! Today we are

gonna be making something Panda Themed, I
got so many requests to make something

Panda themed. And, the newest episode of Table
Top came out, I’ll put a link

down below so you can go check it out. But
I got to play the game Takenoko, which

involves an adorable little panda. So I thought
this is perfect timing, let’s

make something now, we are gonna be making
mini Oreo Cheesecakes and decorate
them to look like panda.
Let’s get started!

Because we are making these from scratch, I
will just explain all the ingredients as we
go along, the first thing that we're gonna do is we are going to make the Oreo crust.

So, you’re gonna take this tray, I’ve
got a Ding-Dong tray, this is not a cupcake tray,

cupcake trays are shaped like this, ding dong
trays are shaped right up and down.

So, I didn’t have a mini cupcake tray, so, a
Ding-Dong tray will do just fine!

They had these at Bed, Bath and Beyond. Then
you can take these, they’re little

cupcake liners, and put ‘em in every little
hole. As you can see the little cupcake

trays, they stick up a little bit, but that’s
OK, because as soon as we put
the crust in, they’ll settle down.

So I’ll put this off to the side, and we’re
gonna make our crust, it’s super easy!

SO what you’re gonna do is you’re gonna
take 12 regular Oreos, like so.

Filling and all, leave the filling in there,
and you don’t want double stuff, just

regular Oreos, you’re gonna toss these in
a blender, blend it up, so it looks like

this, and then pour it in your big bowl. Now
you’re gonna take 1 tablespoon

of softened butter, I just left it out so
that it was room temperature.

Put it in the bowl, oooh-oooh-oooh-oooh! There
we go, aaaaaah!

OK, now we’re gonna get our hands messy,
we’re just gonna mix it up.
What does the Panda say?
Probably, om-nom-nom-nom-nom-na-nom-nom-nom!

Now we’re gonna line the trays with the
Oreo Crust. I like to take the tablespoon,

it’s my favorite measurement for this. Just
take a tablespoon, use a knife,

pack it in there, there we go, and put that
in each tray!

Once you got all the trays filled you're just gonna 
take anything that you find around the

house, I am using a vanilla extract bottle!
And you’re just gonna press it in

there to each tray and pack it down. Twist,
twist, twist, pop, pop, pop!

Now that we’ve got the Oreo crust in the
bottom, we are just gonna throw these
in the oven for 5 minutes at 350.

While our Oreo Crust is baking we are gonna
make our cheesecake filling!

Alright, so the first thing that you’re
gonna do is take a big mixing bowl,

and we’re gonna add 12 ounces of Room temperature
Cream Cheese. So, it’s about

1-1/2 sh-ticks! If you get it in the sh-tick
form.
Alright, ehp-ehp, there we go!

Now you’re gonna add 1/2 a cup of regular
sugar, and beat together.

Now you’re gonna add 1 egg, hi-yah! Pewp!
And we add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
Then you’re gonna mix again.

Last but not least you’re gonna add 5 Oreos.
You’re gonna take 5 Oreo cookies and

you’re gonna twist them apart, like that!
And then you’re gonna eat all

of the center filling! I’m just kidding!
You can just scrape it off,
but I’m gonna eat it!
Oh! Where’s my mouth?!?!
I don’t know! I don’t know!

So I already did these ones to save us some
time, and you’re just gonna take them in
your hand and crush ‘em!
Ba-ha-ha-ha-ha! With your muscles!
There we go!

Now that you got all your cookie crumbs in
there, you’re just gonna take a spatula

or a spoon, whatever you like and just fold
‘em in. Mix it all together!

Alright, I’ve got my tablespoon and now we’re
gonna scoop our cheesecake filling on top

of our Oreo crusts! It’s gonna be really
good!

So just take a big scoop, put him right in
the tray, right on top.

You’re just gonna want to fill it about
75% full, this is more than a cupcake because

cheesecake rises, but very little, it rises
just a teeny bit, so you want to fill them to

be almost full. Now we’ve got all that in
there, what you’re gonna do is tap…

Your tray, lightly on the table to get the
air bubbles out.

OK! Now they’re ready to bake, now you’re
going to reduce the heat of your oven to

325 and you’re going to bake these for 15
minutes.

While our mini cheesecakes are baking, we
are gonna make our little panda decorations

and the whipped cream frosting. The first
thing is we’re gonna make our little

pandas, so you’re gonna take a cookie sheet,
and a piece of wax paper,

and you can pick anything in your kitchen
that’s circular, it’s a little bit

smaller than the tray that we were using for
panda’s face.

So anything that you can find, and I'm
gonna take a sharpie, you can use

a pencil, doesn’t really matter, just something
to trace the circle all the way around.

I’ve lightly traced the little circles.
And now what you’re gonna do is flip it over,

so that the pen is on the back. You’re gonna
take some tape, tape it down.

Now I’m gonna take white chocolate melts,
I’ve heated them up, put them in this little

plastic bag, with a number 2 tip right at
the top. And we’re just gonna trace Panda’s

little face, and then with some black decorating
icing, we’re gonna make panda’s ears,
eyes, nose and mouth!

When you’re done decorating your little chocolate
panda faces, you’re gonna put them in

the freezer to freeze for about 10 minutes
so they get really hard, and they chill.

And while those are sitting in the freezer,
we are gonna make

the whipped cream frosting! So, first thing
you’re gonna do is you’re gonna

take a big mixing bowl, and you’re gonna
take 1 cup of heavy whipping cream,

and you’re gonna beat until you get light
and fluffy peaks.

Bewm, bewm, bewm! OK, I’m doing this so
you can see what soft peaks looks like.

It’s when you kind of dip your beater in
and then you pull it up and then look!

Those are soft little peaks, they’re
standing on their own, they look like
little peaky mountains.

OK, so what you’re gonna do now is you’re
gonna take powdered sugar and we’re gonna

take 2 tablespoons and add it to our mixture,
and you’re also gonna add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract

Now we’re gonna beat on medium/high
speed until stiffer peaks form.

They get even firmer, they look like firmer
mountains.

We just finished our whipped cream frosting
and now I’m just gonna put it in

this little frosting bag, and what I did is
I just put a piece of tape over the

tip so that nothing will come out, and I put
it in a cup, fold the sides down, so it’s

easy to put in there. Then you’re just gonna
scoop it in, and then we’re gonna put

this in the freezer for about 10 minutes to
chill.

I just took the mini cheesecakes out of the
fridge, they’ve been in there for

a couple of hours and now we’re gonna put
everything together.

So what you’re gonna do is, you can leave
the liner on if you want, but I’m taking

it off so you can see what it looks like.
It looks pretty cool! Look at that
it almost looks just like an ice cream sandwich.
Peeling it off, all the way around. Oh yummy!

And, I’m just gonna be decorating a few
to show you how to do it. Then we're

gonna take your whipped cream frosting, and
just make a little circle here

at the top, then you can take one of these
cute little panda faces, ah!

I’m gonna take him because he’s so cute!
And you’re just gonna put him right on top.

Ta-da! Here are our Mini Panda Oreo Cheesecakes,
they are so cute!

Made from scratch, just bit sized and super
yummy!
Om-yum-yum-yum-yum!

Thanks you guys for suggesting something panda,
it was just perfect timing.

If you want to check out the episode of Tabletop
again, I’ll put the link down below

where we play Takenoko! Such a cute game!
We had a great time and if you have any

other suggestions for any other Nerdy Nummies,
please let me know, leave me a comment

down below and I will do my best to make it
happen!

I also have Facebook and Twitter, you can
follow me there, I post lots of

pictures from Nerdy Nummies and I also like
to post fan made baking creations,

so if you have any creations that you’ve
made from Nerdy Nummies, send them to me
on Facebook and I like to post them.
OK, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!
